intro: Haloragis scordioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved water-starflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland or swampy habitats. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, star-shaped white or pale blue flowers. It is adapted to waterlogged soils and can tolerate periodic flooding. Haloragis scordioides plays an important role in maintaining the ecological balance of its wetland environment.
